actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity

official_title: To increase the borrowing authority of the Federal Emergency Management Agency for carrying out the national flood insurance program.
short_title: National Flood Insurance Program Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2006

summary.text: National Flood Insurance Program Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2006 - Amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to increase from $18.5 billion to $24.1 billion, through FY2008, the total amount which the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) may borrow from the Secretary of the Treasury with the President's approval to carry out the flood insurance program.

titles.title: National Flood Insurance Program Enhanced Borrowing Authority Act of 2006
To increase the borrowing authority of the Federal Emergency Management Agency for carrying out the national flood insurance program.
